intro: Calathiana angulosa, commonly known as the angular calathia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its angular, ribbed stems and palmate leaves with three to five lobes. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Calathiana angulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
